name: df-nlm
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cnlm, crab(s0, cin(cngp, clmod), wsbc(s1, cfv(csca, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cnrg), wral(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s1)), wral(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(cnm, cv(s0)), co(cv(s2), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s3))), co(cfv(cfv(cnm, cv(s1)), cv(s2)), cmul, cfv(cfv(cnm, cv(s0)), cv(s3))))))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ NrmMod = { s0 ∈(NrmGrp ⋂ LMod)|[(Scalar ` s0)/ s1](s1 ∈ NrmRing ∧ ∀(s2 ∈(Base ` s1), ∀(s3 ∈(Base ` s0),((norm ` s0)`(s2[(× ` s0)]s3))=(((norm ` s1)` s2)[×]((norm ` s0)` s3)))))}
comment: A normed (left) module is a module which is also a normed group over a normed ring, such that the norm distributes over scalar multiplication. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2015.)
